title: Fix Critical CVE-2025-66478 (React2Shell RCE)
description:
CRITICAL: Remote Code Execution vulnerability in Next.js/React Server Components. CVSS 10.0. This project is currently running vulnerable versions:
- Next.js 15.1.2 (needs 15.1.9+)
- React 19.0.0 (needs 19.0.1+)

Active exploitation in the wild since Dec 5, 2025. Attackers can execute arbitrary code on the server via crafted HTTP requests. No workaround - must upgrade.

Remediation:
1. Upgrade Next.js to 15.1.9+
2. Upgrade React to 19.0.1+
3. Re-deploy application
4. Rotate all application secrets

Sources:
- https://nextjs.org/blog/CVE-2025-66478
- https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-66478
close_reason: Critical CVE-2025-66478 patched. Next.js upgraded to 15.5.9, React to 19.0.3. Secrets rotation deferred.

1. Choose AWS S3 or Google Cloud Storage
2. Install storage adapter: npm install @payloadcms/storage-s3 or @payloadcms/storage-gcs
3. Create bucket and IAM credentials
4. Update payload.config.ts with storage plugin
5. Add environment variables to .env.local and Vercel

title: Payload CMS Frontend Integration & Production Deployment

title: Upgrade Next.js to 15.1.9+ (CVE-2025-66478)
description:
Upgrade Next.js from 15.1.2 to 15.1.9 or later to patch critical RCE vulnerability.

Steps:
1. npm install next@15.1.9 (or latest 15.x patched version)
2. Run npm run build to verify no breaking changes
3. Run npm run dev and test locally
4. Verify all pages load correctly
close_reason: Upgraded Next.js from 15.1.2 to 15.1.11 (fully patched). Build verified. npm audit shows 0 vulnerabilities.
